analytic.title: To the Right Honoura∣BLE THE LORD MARQVESSE HAMILTON, Master of the Horse to his MAIESTIE, IAMES HAMILLTON: ANAGRAMMA, I AMM ALL HONESTY.

monogr.title: All the vvorkes of Iohn Taylor the water-poet : Beeing sixty and three in number. Collected into one volume by the author: vvith sundry new additions, corrected, reuised, and newly imprinted, 1630
monogr.author: Taylor, John

div.head: To the Right HonouraBLE THE LORD MARQVESSE HAMILTON, Master of the Horse to his MAIESTIE, IAMES HAMILLTON: ANAGRAMMA, I AMM ALL HONESTY.
div.l: Of words, 'tis vaine to vse a Multitude,
Your very Name all Goodnesse doth include.
div.p: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE, THE Lord Steward of his Maiesties Honourable HOVSEHOLD,
WILLIAM HERBERT EARLE OF PENBROKE ANAGRAMMA. LIBERALY MEEK • , FOR REPVTE HONOVRABLE.
div.l: What can be more then is explained here,
T' expresse a worthy well deseruing Peere?
div.p: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE, THE LORD Chamberlaine of his Maiesties most Honourable HOVSEHOLD,
PHILIP HERBERT EARLE OFF MONTGOMERY. ANAGRAMMA, FIRME FAITH BEGOT ALL MY PROPER HONER.
div.l: Firme faith begot mi • e honor (sayes my name)
And my firme faith shalleuer keepe the same.
